nodes.bodyText: o p t i o n s p e c
It might not be a bad idea to look at using a redirect here, or a ModifyArg as this mixin is going to be super fragile to updates.

Yeah I had a similar thing in the server world load event. The local variable are insanity. If you do choose that please note with a comment about how the redirect is easier to maintain than a modify arg due to large amount of local variables.
Maybe put the ID of the registry in the exception
Maybe quote what player said about this injection here on discord?
This completely ignores outputTag. I'd move the version wrapping to read/writeCompoundTag.
It may be desirable to fix the bug with vanilla datapacks too?

isModded in this case means any registry entry that contains an entry not in the minecraft namespace. The datapack I was testing with used its own namespace. I might be wrong but I would assume all custom biomes to not use the minecraft namespace?
Right, that's fine IMO. Maybe clarify the comment a little?
Do we want to validate rawId too? (skip < 0)
I think the registry is gonna give you -1 if the object is not keyed in registry
